Sentencas: In the compound BaMg2Si2O7, the Mg2+-ions can completely be replaced by Co2+-ions.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The resulting solid solutions show a phase transition from a low to a high temperature phase.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Both, the thermal expansion behavior as well as the phase transition temperature change significantly with the Mg/Co-ratio.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The phase transition runs parallel to an increase in volume, which can be detected using dilatometry.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The introduction of small CoO concentrations leads to an increase in the phase transition temperature.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: In order to determine the thermal expansion behavior, dilatometty, as well as high temperature X-ray diffraction was used.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The substitution of MgO by up to 50 mol% CoO does not lead to a significant change in the thermal expansion behavior.
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: The measured coefficients of thermal expansion lie in a range between 7.0 and 24.0 x 10(-6)K(-1).
Titulo: Thermal expansion behavior in the solid solution series BaMg2-xCoxSi2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 2), studied by dilatometry and in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction
